On june 14, 2012
pickupsticks

Actually, I prefer Beretta when there's no upgrades to go along with it. The rate of fire means pretty much the same damage-per-second but with the chance to switch targets if the first shot is a kill. More efficient use of ammo.
When you throw upgraded ammo (or trigger happy) into the mix then I think that the dual pistols creep ahead for their chance to make sure someone dies before there is a chance for interruption.

On june 15, 2012
Xtremekiwi

Upgraded my trooper to level 10, he has a choice between Stamp and Out of Bounds. He has:
Soldier, M16, Thompson, Grenade, Frag Grenade, Heartbreaker, Huge Calves, First aid Kit, Tuck 'n' Roll.
My army is 8 strong and I have no scouts. Any advice?
On june 15, 2012
pickupsticks

Do you adapt your army based on who you are fighting? If so, OOB is a solid pick for you. It gives you much more control over the size of each wave of your army, depending on your deployment order.
If you need extra numbers to out-gun someone, or you want a smaller deployment to minimize losses to an AOE weapon, then OOB is your tool.

Of course, if you tend to just set the army up and bash them against whoever you face in your "standard set-up" then it's not as useful (although it is still useful). Whether I'd consider Stamp or not depends on how many other troopers you have that knock people down. If you've got a lot of shotguns, revolvers and explosives going on then it could be a good pick.

Personally I'd probably go with OOB, but it depends on your situation really.
On june 15, 2012
[1841726]

You're in the "middle stages" Xtremekiwi were team orientation begins to matter. "Out of Bounds" is a cross-road. Getting or not getting it will either make or break you. and frankly it is you, the best person to know this army's composition, who should have the better opinion. And that's why me, as an outsider, will side with stamp on this one because it seems it is a "neutral" choice. Even though it won't offer "super scary advantageous" perks it has no "negative" side effects. With grenade and frag this trooper can easily put enemies into the ground (any munitions or bazokaa teammates perhaps?) then using his huge calves (for faster closing-in) and tuc'knroll (for safe closing-in), fallen enemies will have no time to stand-up and recover. Remember for an 8 army transition to a 12 army, out-of-bonds is all or nothing, a "special weapon" or "achilles heel." If you're foresight will be good it can offer more benefits than stamp, but if you fail this skill will be the demise of your army. or am I going to0 far Oh the beauty of this game

Speaking of paralyze...

Trooper Deal in Kings and Liars is getting an upgrade today.
She's got:
Soldier
Double Barrel Shotgun, AR, CK-M
Charge, Unforgiving, Cold Blooded, Heat Sensor
Dodger, Motorbike
Options are paralyzing shells or huge calves.
The shells would be a good offensive choice,making her more deadly. The "never miss a second shot" benefit doesn't really apply here as she's already got the heatsensor, but it would help the other troopers out.
Then again, the CKM is a heavy weapon so the huge calves would increase mobility, as well as adding to longevity.

Worth a little bit of consideration before I jump one way or the other - thought I'd post it up here too so that you, dear reader, could exercise your brain a bit too. Everyone's a winner.

Doomys

I don't like any of the 3 choices but I would probably take blind fury or talky walky...
On july 21, 2012
pickupsticks

They're not that bad of choices.
Talkywalky gives a "just deployed" init boost to whichever trooper you bring in, and I'm starting to like it more and more.
Blind Fury might be helpful for when the tank deploys, to make getting a shot off better.
Scav is a good skill on two counts. It gets you a weapon if you're sabotaged out (not such an issue here for a smart guy) and it deprives the enemy of a weapon. It being an equipment slot is a bit of a drag though.

I'd personally probably go for the talkywalky, but if you're trying to keep the number of troopers you have on the field to a minimum then blind fury is probably the better option IMO.

On july 25, 2012
mogman
solidgryffinWhat is the wife beater bug?ArnulfIt uses two equipment slots, even though it only shows one used next to the trooper image.

Close... If you have 2 equipment already and pick wife beater on a level up you won't be able to switch to wife beater, not even manipulating the link to the one that switches equipment (http://mogman.minitroopers.com/t/5?eq... for example). You will need a 4th equipment to actually do any switching... Very frustrating, forced me to level my spy as I was trying to manipulate the link and ended up accidentally using the level up one instead haha... Got him his 4th equipment that way though, so no all bad.

For the fellow with a spy... Take cover is great if your spy has a weapon that needs him to actually stop to reload. If he uses pump action shot gun or a mini gun or other large clip size gun and has battle ready or loader there really is no point as the reload time is so quick it won't matter and he probably won't get past the first clip or 2 anyways (will kill them off quick or they will kill him off quick).

Pause, unforgiving is a slam-dunk for a trooper with a knife.

Soitbegins, I would also go with rocket launcher purely so as not to slow your trooper down - IF he didn't already have sprinter. With sprinter you can probably get away with taking the heavy armour.

Your call. An extra weapon is never a bad thing, but the armour is very useful, especially for a shock trooper who's going to get shot up a lot.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Thanks for the input, I think I will go for Enthusiastic.
I understand that unforgiving is good but for knife guy enthusiastic is also good.

If Enthusiastic is +25% 'over all' then in the same time that should change 4 Knife hits to 5 hits (I think thats right, hmmm?)
So effectively both skills would be adding damage.

4 knife hits = 12 damage.
with enthusiastic: + 1 hit (or +3 damage) = 15 damage
...or...
with unforgiving: +1 damage per hit (or 3 +4 +4 +4) = 15 damage

over time they are both the same thing.
I like the idea of Enthusiastic because of the extra chance of a kill shout or working a wound.

On august 6, 2012
SilentPinoy
mogmanYou're probably gonna be hoping for battle ready with the heavy machine guns. Makes them much more effective when they got the full clip ready to roll.

Nope, could care less about it. The point is that DBS is his main assault weapon. With any small clip weapons, a unit will take priority in reloading over changing weapons, and a Shotgun type works great in conjunction with Frenetic while a Heavy Machine Gun type are better suited for transitioning into for weapon switching. Once he runs out of ammo he barrages through the Minigun and Desert Eagle in a cycle. By this time if a resupply hasn't come in via him killing all of the enemy he becomes a prime target for death, and by then the rest of my army is already in preparation, either in aiming(Fighter's Infernal Tube and Bard's CK-Magellan) or moving closer into position(Ranger's and sometimes Paladin's Assault Rifle weapons or Cleric's PAS).

Edit:
What I also mean is that if I start with my Minigun, when Wizard runs out of ammo he'll switch to his DBS, shoot once, and then switch to Desert Eagle, cycle back to Minigun and start slowly reloading. It's much more efficient to have DBS which has more killing potential to fuel Frenetic and then cycle through the higher clip weapons. Once he's done he cycles back to the DBS which is fast to reload.

On august 8, 2012
pickupsticks

While I like minigun + explosive shells as a combo, even without any aim bonuses, I think that Mos-Tech is the better option here.
You want a high critical chance to get the best out of the multiplier from Heartbreaker.
MT would give 25 x 3 = 75, which is respectable. Dealing 6/7 damage with the explosive shells gives you 12/14, which again is some good stopping power even if you don't get the crit.
If you already had sprinter or sturdy then I'd prefer the minigun, but as it stands I think the MT is a stronger choice.

On september 15, 2012
[1841726]

Xtremekiwi


I saved up enough credits to level up Nightblade's soldier today and got myself a choice of:

Sprinter
Barrel Extension
Death Grip

He's got: Soldier (as I stated), Assault Rifle, AK47, Hydroshock Shells, Fragmentation Grenade, Smart, Covering Fire, Flashbang, Tuck 'n' Roll, Motorcycle.

Sprinter would help me get into range faster in case he doesn't deploy on the motorcycle, Barrel Extension would give him valuable range (even if having to replace the flashbang from which I actually got a lot of good use) while Death Grip would help with not dropping his weapons.
My personal choice is on sprinter here.
Barrel Extension is a no-no since you have already 3 equipment. But if ever you stick around it is always a good combination with covering fire. But be aware if ever you got wife beater for the next level you will be wasting 3 equipments instead of two.
Death Grip is a situational pick. A nice skill to augment the odds if ever you're soldier got sabotage. But the chances of sabotage is low since he's smart.
Sprinter has no risk of wasting lvls like Barrel Extension and can be utilize more than Death Grip here. Especially since ak47 has a minimum firing range you're soldier can run faster to firing range and shoot a close enemy (imagine, an enemy pilot-motor knife trooper or an infiltrating spy) and will not waste important game-breaking commands like solo missions. I think that this case is more annoying and is more game-breaking than weapons falling and so I think that sprinter will be more beneficial than Death grip. Also ak47 has the longest max range of all the assault rifle so the benefit of barrel extension is damped.
On september 15, 2012
pickupsticks

I'd disagree that the effect is dampened - AK47 with barrel extension is even better. I love extra range.
In this case though I'd agree sprinter is the best choice by quite a margin. Also, if you pick up heavy weapons later it will keep you mobile and effective.

Doomys

Thermos of coffee doesn't affect movement speed. It only affects action speed. Action speed is the type of speed that affects every action that the trooper does ex: reloading, switching weapons, aiming, etc. except movement.

More info here: http://minitroopers.wikia.com/wiki/Sp...
(It tells which skills affect which type of speed)

I would pick the thermos

Kompera
XtremekiwiThe thing with Scavenger is that you need to be a certain distance away from the enemy to be actually able to take it.

I'd have taken the Scavenger also. It has a range that to me appears to be just over half the battlefield. A Spy with On Point will be in range immediately if he deploys with the enemy, and in one action otherwise.

It's also always there, and is a great addition to an army with a Saboteur, since it operates afterwards and strips yet another weapon. Scavenger also ignores both Smart and Suspicious i.e. it always works when used, there is no enemy skill which can counter it.

Covering Fire it is. Thanks guys, I'm afraid that the command "locked" will counter zigzag. It is interesting to note that covering fire was offered 2 times on this trooper.
Karry
I would recommend rush . I'm assuming that his favorite weapon is lizaro jungle, with a sniper for anti-spy he would have a hard time fulfilling his role since whenever a spy infiltrate your line he would have to move for minimum range. But with rush and on-point, he would have almost 100% assurance that he can fire his lethal shot (wow in his explo and hydro plus the high critical rate of sniper fire and he is a one-shot monster)
This method is also used by my anti-spy and I can say that he is good doing his job. His favorite weapon is sparrowhawk and he has heart-breaker and toxic shells. He moves with his on-point and fires with his rush and dead enemy spy . I set him at closest target.
Regarding with restless, I find it lackluster since the bonus initiative is somewhat overshadowed by the default initiative bonus of the enemy's next wave. Heck, I've seen a motorcyclist move first than the restless trooper. But in your case, I can see that it will also be beneficial since he is a range trooper (?). I find restless good with range troopers . Hopes that helps

On september 29, 2012
pickupsticks

FAMAS has the same critical chance as the pistols, but slightly better aim percentage. However as a burst weapon, the later shots will be more likely to miss unless you have a compensator.
Personally I would take the pistols because of the extra range, and because if you pick up trigger happy then they become really lethal with the hydroshocks.

It's situational, though. If you are using your trooper as mid-to-short range then the FAMAS is probably going to be more useful.

Kompera

doomysBut here is my opinion: Take any trooper. Give him smart, he might become a good trooper. Give him frenetic and you are almost sure that he will end up as a great trooper. If not, at least you know in advance that he won't be your worst trooper.I disagree.
There is no denying that Frenetic is one of the best skills. But so is Smart and a small handful of other skills. Frenetic as an opening skill will see that Trooper performing well at early levels. But are you building for a L6 army?

Smart as an opening skill will have offered you 15 choices by L6. The Frenetic Trooper will have been offered 10 choices. Sure, there's no guarantee that the best 5 out of every three skills per level-up will be better than the best 5 out of two skills per level-up, but my money is on the odds that the Trooper will be better built even if he doesn't get offered Frenetic by L6. And this advantage curve continues to pull ahead with every additional level-up.

Plus, the other strong benefits of Smart: 50% immunity to sabotage, immune to Propaganda, Bait, and Bibi le Clown. So, the Smart Trooper shoots at the targets the owner programmed him for, will never swap sides, and keeps his primary weapon more often than a Trooper without Smart.

On october 16, 2012
Cripto

In my opinion, on point, twinoid and frenetic are all a lot more useful than smart by a large margin. Initiative is the single most important aspect in the game and frenetic is arguably the best of the initiative skills. Initiative is what makes spies the over powered class that they are and is usually what makes the difference between losing and winning a fight. Smart, on the other hand, doesn't really impact fights all that much. Other than the anti-sabotage, its benefits are really insignificant and barely make any difference in fights. In my opinion, its a nice skill but not really the kind of game breaker skill that frenetic can be. Give frenetic to a decent trooper with a decent weapon and he'll become 10 times better. Give smart to the same trooper instead and there'd be little to no visible changes in how he fights. Just my two cents

On october 22, 2012
Kompera

This is more of a "What should I have taken?", since I've already selected.

Han Solo of The Solo (Fight where you can see his stats) was offered UMP and FAMAS (and as a Smart Trooper, Reverse Attack, which is useless in the one-on-one format he was built for.)


I took the UMP for the following reasons:

+ Han has no speed increases and previously only range 4 weapons. This led to multiple cases of his taking Twinoid and running into range, only to stop before firing as he'd used all the Twinoid initiative moving. Then the poison ticks begin and he's getting shot at before he can ever return fire. UMP has a 2-6 range vs. a 5 range for FAMAS, which will hopefully allow him to both close and fire before the Twinoid initiative runs out.

+ Han has Heartbreaker and UMP has a X20 critical vs. a X10 for the FAMAS. And of course a favorite target of "Straight in the heart!" I don't know if they stack, but if they do I wanted to capitalize on this. UMP also has a 100% accuracy vs. 90 for FAMAS, but this was not a consideration as Han has Eye of the Tiger and that pushes both weapons into a very respectable hit rate.

- On the minus side, UMP has a minimum range, which can produce a lot of running around to get out of range 1 and able to shoot, as can be seen in the linked battle. The FAMAS has no minimum range. FAMAS also has a much quicker recovery time (50 vs. 80).

Other than the above pluses and minuses, the two weapons are identical in damage, capacity, and munitions.


Thoughts?

[1841726]
cloud891

Tomorrow I would get enough credits to level up one of my trooper in my main army http://cloud891.minitroopers.com/hq to level 12 and I wanna ask everyone's opinion on who should be upgraded. Here are some replays to see them in action

http://cloud891.minitroopers.com/b/fv...
http://cloud891.minitroopers.com/b/fv...
http://smart-karry.minitroopers.com/b...

Since I'm playing in the Championship Sixes where the top armies are mostly Spy centered army I'm leaning towards leveling up my Pilot or Sab to become a more effective anti-spy. I feel that if they ever get On Point, Twinoid, or Suspicious (for the Pilot) and Motorcycle (for the Sab) they would be able to take down enemy Spies without a hitch.

I share the same sentiments with you in thinking that your Pilot and Sabs are your best trooper in countering a spy and thus will greatly improve your army with every level-up.
*My default option would be the saboteur. It offers a great advantage with his global influence of "sabotage" which is huge in small armies. If it take two lvl. 13 sabs to output a 100% sabotage in a 12 man army maybe it would take to one lvl. 12 sabs to output 100% on a six man army (There's actually a formula but I forgot maybe somebody can provide?) and Luna is already lvl. 11, he's getting nearer.
*There is so much to say about the Pilot. One thing, between him and Luna he is the better anti-spy and personally I can say he's one of the best if not the best anti-spy in the champion sixes. In your army, he has the highest chance of surviving a spy onslaught. He got two things: One is his ever ready motorcycle, it provide a shield (extra hp) to mitigate the first burst of the spy and an initiative, there are times too that a pilot-motorcycle can act quicker than a spy or any on-point troopers. Second is his adrenaline coupled with rush, which will steal the initiative of a spy and thus will effectively stop an infiltration. I personally believes that the moving/dynamic initiative of Lapu-lapu outweighs the static initiative of Luna (suspicious.)
Also, Lapu-lapu is more dynamic than Luna in a sense that he can fulfill many roles. Yeah he's an excellent anti-spy but he can also be an exemplary shock trooper. There is no need to have a two anti-spy trooper in every battle and I think that this is also the main reason why you're having a hard time against some enemies. Look at spy-onic in this battle you provided: http://cloud891.minitroopers.com/b/fv..., the snipers single handedly stop your troopers from advancing that led to your demise. You could have just set Lapu-lapu with his knife to target the doctor to disallow minimum sniper range and even cause friendly fire from the two machine guns. Trust Luna to dispatch the on-point-less Inco Gnito. I think that you only need lapu-lapu to act as anti-spy to jan18's and smart-karry's army.
Personally I would go leveling Lapu-lapu since the effect of sabotage is minimized by smart enemies which is abundant in Championship Sixes. Also, Lapu-lapu has two vacant equipment slots compared to his 5 comrades and this will make upgrading less risky and painful. Good luck there buddy

Kompera

MomahWeapons: PAS, Rocket launcher, Infernal tube, mos-teck and sniper
Skills: Smart, on point, charge and fragmentation grenade

[...] charge is uselessYou missed a skill, what's his Officer type?

Charge is a free 5 points of damage plus knockdown damage, and it goes up by the health of your trooper. So if this guy is a Soldier he'll do 4 more damage (at this level), and if you took Brick S***house it'd be 5 more, killing instantly any trooper who has no health skills and doing significant damage to any trooper. And it never runs out of ammo.

Only the Infernal Tube and MOS-TECK are heavy weapons, you shouldn't be too slow to close to Charge range, especially with On Point giving you some good initial initiative.

Pause
irocksonnyweapons: shotgun, scatter gun, ck-magellan
vehicles: motorcycle

Sorry to go off topic but you have the magellan in bold. Is this your staring weapon?
You should try having the scatter gun as the starting weapon with the motorcycle, it's all about enemy sabotage.

If the scatter gun is sabotaged he will jump off the cycle and switch to the magellan.
...or...
If the magellan is sabotaged he will fly in with the scatter gun.
Either way the enemy saboteur can't win, they would need to sabotage both weapons (unlikely).

What you want to avoid is having the pilot jump off the cycle and then start walking in holding a scatter gun.

pickupsticks

Semi-auto is probably my 2nd favourite shotgun, but in this case I'd almost certainly take Sprinter.
It combines so well with so many different things. Heavy weapons are not a problem any more. Short range weapons like knife and shotguns are not so risky as you close the distance faster. It works even better with rush, or charge. It makes choosing hunter to disrupt the enemy secure-zone weapons a viable option, and it makes choosing defender to pull back, reload and fire with desert eagles a viable option.
It's a skill that I under-valued early in my experience, to the dismay of my army.

So, yeah. I like it.

On january 17, 2013
Pause
KOFKOREAI'm thinking about Charge >= Battle-Ready > FAMAS

Charge + Soldier is great!

You will be adding 1 to your charge damage evey second level up, even if your next skills are trash.
The knock down is also great, it's usually as good as killing the enemy.

Yes battle-ready is a good skill but not here for this trooper.
As your trooper will be walking in he will be using the long range revolver.
The revolver is always loaded at the start of a fight anyway, battle-ready does nothing.
The pistol is junk and so battle-ready can only really help the Semi-Auto Shotgun.

The Semi-Auto's starting capacity is 4, so 1 in 4 battles you would have full ammo anyway and then battle-ready would be doing nothing.
Battle-ready would only really help in the 1 in 4 battles when your trooper would have been given 1 starting ammo AND even then only after firing off all 6 revolver shots and firing off the first 1 Semi-Auto shot.

Like all shotguns the first problem is range, Charge will help with this too.

Kompera
eginid probly go for on point...
atleast u can get 1 shot in with that and with frenetic i highly doubt u will be able to reload double barrel in time...

I agree. I almost always take On Point before Frenetic if offered both on the same level-up. The ability to go first or at least early is often the difference between doing something and dying before you get to act. Frenetic is a great skill, but it doesn't do much if you are killed before you can trigger it.

I wouldn't pick it based on your current weapon, however. A few levels will probably see you with something better.

karry

My trooper has:

smart, sprinter, camouflage, AR

offered:

cold blooded
trigger happy
hydroshock shells

You should try to create a build for him. What Specialization you want for him, first? That may change what you gonna choose in all another levels.
Other thing is: what skill he already have? Smart is awesome, for starting... Now, about Camo and Sprinter; you can make a 'invisible' shock trooper. Trust me, a invisible guy runnin', then firing from behind hmmm really can win a battle. But you can make a good support one. Choosing between shock and support is important to decide the helmet.
But keep in mind: picking Hydros, you should know what kind of weapons you seek. If you're going after Snipers~UMP, Hydros. If you're going after Shotguns or Machine guns, Coldblooded.

He would be a awesome Doc, tough.
